page.title: 17Kelton Mains Farm
page.content: Mr Edgar has been farming for 23 years. He has 196 acres, 155 acres of arable, 40 acres of rough grazing, including Threave Island and woods, one acre for roads, buildings etc. The National Trust took 7 acres in 1974. They planted trees and made a car park for visitors to Threave Castle. The main crop is grass. Mr Edgar does not employ full time workers but he employs people at busy times such as harvest. The animals he has are sheep, store cattle and multi-suckling cows. In the future he thinks it will be difficult because people are buying less dairy produce. Farms will be more computerised.
